description: {"blocks":[{"key":"80ucm","text":"Protocol is mainly inspired from: WormBook Methods http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_strainmaintain/strainmaintain.html.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":71}],"data":{}},{"key":"bu0b7","text":"This protocol is for making medium for foraging experiments with the worm Caenorhabditis elegans. The medium has the same basis as the standard Nematode Growth Medium (NGM), but contains no peptone (as no long-term worm growth is required for our experiments), and contains antibiotics that prevent our bacterial strains from growing (bacteriostatic concentrations).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":74,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e65no","text":"It describes both medium preparation and pouring. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"67E0D672B1E911ED88870A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_strainmaintain/strainmaintain.html"}}}}

related_materials.name: Falcon® 100 mm TC-treated Cell Culture Dish
Plastic petri dish 35 x 10 mm style
Ethanol absolute ≥99.8% AnalaR NORMAPUR® ACS Reag. Ph. Eur. Analytical Reagent

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"brarh","text":"In order to perform this protocol, you will need the following solutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4bej","text":"5 mg/mL cholesterol in absolute ethanol (stored in freezer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24bkq","text":"pH=6 phosphate buffer (as prepared in: https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-0-5l-of-phosphate-buffer-ph-6-0-n2bvj8r7bgk5/v1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":92}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o2r0","text":"1 M magnesium sulfate (as prepared in: https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-magnesium-sulfate-solution-mgso4-ca4rsgv6)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":39,"length":89}],"data":{}},{"key":"931va","text":"1 M calcium chloride (as prepared in: https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-calcium-chloride-solution-cacl2-b8parvie)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":38,"length":88}],"data":{}},{"key":"b07i6","text":"10 mg/mL chloramphenicol in absolute ethanol (stored in freezer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5lrb","text":"50 mg/mL novobiocin in milliQ water (filter-sterilized and then stored in freezer, in 1.8 mL aliquots to avoid defreezing-refreezing the whole stock)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"215EAD333E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-0-5l-of-phosphate-buffer-ph-6-0-n2bvj8r7bgk5/v1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"215EAC653E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-magnesium-sulfate-solution-mgso4-ca4rsgv6"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"215EACD33E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-calcium-chloride-solution-cacl2-b8parvie"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqvaf","text":"Add   of agar powder to a 1L clean bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"16","error":false,"guid":"A9F2DD393E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"±0.2","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4utmi","text":"Put the bottle on a stirrer, and wait until it cools down to around 60°C. At this temperature, the bottle should feel very hot to the touch, but one can hold it for a while without feeling too uncomfortable. The agar should still be liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dd0tp","text":"While the mix is being stirred, do the following steps in that order, dispensing the reagents right above the surface (to avoid bubbles) with a sterile pipette: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97d9i","text":"Add   of phosphate buffer as prepared in https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-0-5l-of-phosphate-buffer-ph-6-0-n2bvj8r7bgk5/v1. This should be added first to prevent any unnecessary precipitation of the next reagents. Wait for ~20 seconds after adding the buffer to give it time to mix well and stabilize the pH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":92}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"C16432953E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"step_guid":"DB7C9AD0BB1011ECBE2CAFB780744C01","title":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"C16433903E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"step_guid":"DB7C9AD0BB1011ECBE2CAFB780744C01","title":"","unit":2,"url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-0-5l-of-phosphate-buffer-ph-6-0-n2bvj8r7bgk5/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tiau","text":"Add   of 1M magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) solution as prepared in https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-magnesium-sulfate-solution-mgso4-ca4rsgv6. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":89}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"C40792D53E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"step_guid":"112F8D90BB1111ECBE2CAFB780744C01","title":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"C40793E83E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"step_guid":"112F8D90BB1111ECBE2CAFB780744C01","title":"","unit":2,"url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-magnesium-sulfate-solution-mgso4-ca4rsgv6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anmo8","text":"For this step only, you can put the pipette right below the surface of the agar, otherwise cholesterol tends to stick to the surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l0tt","text":"Add   of cholesterol (5 mg/mL in absolute ethanol, stored in freezer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"C7A4C5623E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"step_guid":"DB7C9AD0BB1011ECBE2CAFB780744C01","title":"","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"pkn4","text":"Add   of chloramphenicol (10 mg/mL in absolute ethanol, stored in freezer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"D6A63B723E5811EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49nhs","text":"Add   of novobiocin (50 mg/mL in milliQ water, stored in freezer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.6","error":false,"guid":"D8B5D9943E5811EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ibc3","text":"Add   of 1M calcium chloride (CaCl2) solution as prepared in https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-calcium-chloride-solution-cacl2-b8parvie.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":88}],"data":{}},{"key":"3n6im","text":"This step should make the medium a bit cloudier, but remain translucent. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"CE0AEDB13E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.8","error":false,"guid":"CE0AEE943E5711EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2,"url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-1m-calcium-chloride-solution-cacl2-b8parvie"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"baobq","text":"Pour in petri dishes before it solidifies, using a pipette and trying to have the same volume in all dishes. We usually pour the plates on the bench, but to minimize the chance of contamination one can pour them in a microbiology hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akhpd","text":"These are our usual volumes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bj19","text":"For 100x20mm (diameter x height) petri dishes, we pour 18 mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbfjn","text":"For 60x15mm petri dishes, we pour 8 mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mg8n","text":"For 35x10mm petri dishes, we pour 2 mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aecvt","text":"We store our experimental plates at room temperature for 2 to 8 days. For longer storage and better plate quality, the plates are sometimes stacked in boxes that are sealed with a plastic bag, in order to reduce evaporation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Preparation of 1L of Foraging Medium
